intro: Senecio popayanensis, commonly known as the Popayán groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, showcasing its adaptability to high-altitude environments. Its foliage is generally grayish-green, with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Senecio popayanensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native ecosystems.
